intro: Bidens peucedanifolia var. tiraquensis, commonly known as the Tiraquén Bidens, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has hairy, lobed leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, schizocarp fruits. It is noted for its adaptability to arid conditions and has been used traditionally in local medicine.
